Returns: audio fallback mode Value is @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_DEFAULT_E@, @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_MUTE_E@, or @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_FAIL_E@
Throws: if the audio fallback mode is not set.

allowDefaults().Description: Allows defaults to be returned for properties not set. Otherwise a @B_java#lang#IllegalArgumentException_E@ exception is raised when getting those properties which have defaults but have never been set.

Returns: a bitmask indicating the set of special object types marshaled by this Parcelable object instance. Value is either 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@
describeContents().Description: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable instance's marshaled representation. For example, if the object will include a file descriptor in the output of @B_android#os#Parcelable#writeToParcel_E@, the return value of this method must include the @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@ bit.

ClassDesc: Structure for common playback params. Used by @B_android#media#AudioTrack_E@ @B_android#media#AudioTrack#getPlaybackParams_E@ and @B_android#media#AudioTrack#setPlaybackParams_E@ to control playback behavior. @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_DEFAULT_E@: System will determine best handling. @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_MUTE_E@: Play silence for params normally out of range. @B_android#media#PlaybackParams#AUDIO_FALLBACK_MODE_FAIL_E@: Return @B_java#lang#IllegalArgumentException_E@ from AudioTrack.setPlaybackParams(PlaybackParams). Different combinations of speed and pitch may be used for audio playback; some common ones: Pitch equals 1.0f. Speed change will be done with pitch preserved, often called timestretching. Pitch equals speed. Speed change will be done by resampling, similar to @B_android#media#AudioTrack#setPlaybackRate_E@.
